title: US Farmers Produce 3.6 Billion Pounds of ALMONDS this Way - Harvesting and Processing

tasks.task: Farmer prepares almond orchards for planting.
subtasks: Timing planting to mid-February to allow optimal growing season development.
Planting almond seedlings while ensuring proper spacing.
Applying protective covers to shield seedlings from pests and excessive sunlight.

tasks.task: Orchard maintenance during young almond tree growth (Years 1-2).
subtasks: Providing consistent care through regular irrigation monitoring.
Installing drip irrigation systems for efficient water delivery.
Monitoring tree health for signs of disease or pest infestation.
Pruning trees at the beginning of winter to shape, remove dead/diseased branches, and improve air circulation.
Orchards blooming in February-March with white and pink flowers.
Introduction of honey bees during flowering period for pollination.
Ensuring proper nutrient uptake and irrigation during fruit development (5-6 months).
Timing harvest in late summer/early fall when almonds are mature.
Utilizing specialized machines to shake almonds from trees.
Collecting fallen almonds post-machine harvest.
Drying almonds either naturally or through traditional methods (if applicable).
Transporting dried almonds to processing facilities.
Cleaning, sorting, and shelling almonds using advanced machinery.
Sorting almonds based on size and quality for packaging.
Packaging almonds for freshness and contamination prevention.
Distributing packaged almonds to markets and stores globally.
